content: i'm working on libstd, and sometimes code examples in doc comments get highlighted, but sometimes not. is this expected? do i need to be more patient for some slow processing to catch up?
Hard to say, might be a bug, might something like "code is cfged-out". If this is minizes to a usual cargo project, that's def a bug!
If the doc comment is inside/on a cfg-ed out item then its expected. Otherwise its most likely a bug.

for the most part since the most recent update, it is managing to highlight doc comment examples more consistently now, probably due to the cfg(test) issue that was recently fixed? i guess technically i'm working inside libcore, which was the main thing that was affected. but it can still take a while (bulk of actual module code gets highlighted, but the formatting of examples takes a while to catch up)
